title: Licensed Esthetician - Independent Contractor
description:
**Job Overview**  
We are seeking a skilled and passionate Esthetician to join our dynamic team. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in skincare treatments and a commitment to providing exceptional customer service as well as an established clientele with room to grow. As an Esthetician, you will be responsible for delivering a range of beauty services while ensuring a welcoming and relaxing environment for clients. Your expertise in various treatments and products will help enhance the overall guest experience. This is an independent contractor position, meaning you create your own schedule, manage your own clients and work the days you want!

**Duties**

* Perform a variety of esthetic services including facials, body waxing, eyelash extensions, Lash lifts and tints.
* Maintain high standards of sanitation and cleanliness in accordance with industry regulations.
* Utilize salon software, VAGARO for scheduling appointments and managing client records.
* Provide excellent customer service by engaging with clients, understanding their needs, and recommending appropriate treatments or products.
* Conduct product demos and upsell retail items to enhance client satisfaction and drive sales.
* Manage front desk operations including greeting guests, answering inquiries, and processing payments.
* Stay updated on the latest trends in esthetics.
* Collaborate with team members to ensure a seamless guest experience while maintaining a positive work environment.

**Experience**

* Proven experience as a Licensed Esthetician or in a similar role within the beauty industry is preferred. Advanced esthetic certification is a plus!
* Strong knowledge of skincare products, color theory, and various treatment techniques.
* Experience with social media management to promote services and engage with clients online is a plus.
* Excellent communication skills with the ability to build rapport with clients effectively.
* Familiarity with retail sales practices and upselling techniques will be advantageous.

Job Type: Contract

Pay: From $30\.00 per hour

Expected hours: 15 – 40 per week

Benefits:

* Flexible schedule
* Free parking

Work Location: In person

title: Tax Professional
description:
About Us

Elite Royalty Consulting is a full\-service financial services firm that specializes in tax preparation, bookkeeping, life insurance, credit repair, and business consulting. We are dedicated to empowering individuals and small businesses with the tools they need to thrive. Our team is growing, and we’re looking for motivated individuals to join us as **Independent Tax Professionals** for the upcoming tax season.

Position Overview

As an Independent Tax Professional, you will work as a **contractor** preparing and filing individual and/or business tax returns. This is a great opportunity for entrepreneurial self\-starters who want flexibility, professional training, and the chance to earn competitive income.

Responsibilities

* Prepare and file accurate federal and state tax returns for individuals and small businesses.
* Communicate with clients to gather required documents and answer tax\-related questions.
* Maintain compliance with IRS rules and due diligence requirements.
* Provide excellent customer service while maintaining client confidentiality.
* Stay updated on current tax laws and changes.

What We Offer

* **Flexible Schedule:** Work remotely and set your own hours.
* **Training \& Mentorship:** Access to ongoing training, tax law updates, and support.
* **Software \& Tools:** Professional tax software and CRM system provided.
* **Marketing Support:** Guidance on how to grow your own client base and maximize earnings.
* **Growth Opportunities:** Option to expand into other services such as credit repair, bookkeeping, or financial consulting.

Qualifications

* Previous tax preparation experience is preferred but **not required** (training available).
* PTIN (Preparer Tax Identification Number) required or ability to obtain before tax season.
* Strong communication skills and attention to detail.
* Ability to work independently and manage client relationships.
* Entrepreneurial mindset with a passion for financial literacy and client success.

Compensation

* **1099 Contractor Role** – Commission\-based pay with unlimited earning potential.
* Competitive split percentages based on experience and performance.

How to Apply

If you’re ready to take control of your schedule, increase your income, and help clients achieve financial peace of mind, we’d love to hear from you!

Apply today by submitting your resume through Indeed or contacting us directly at **terika@eliteroyaltyconsulting.com**.

Job Type: Contract

Pay: $49,814\.00 \- $80,000\.00 per year

Benefits:

* Flexible schedule

Application Question(s):

* Do you consider yourself business minded and a self starter?
* Why are you interested in becoming a tax professional?
* Are you willing to learn new skills and obtain a life insurance license?
* Are you willing to invest in license and training materials?

title: Salesforce Senior Solution/Demo Architect
description:
**Job Description**

As a Senior Salesforce Solution Architect/Demo Engineer, you’re comfortable spinning up complex, narrative\-ready environments on the Salesforce platform. You have experience working both solo and collaborating with cross\-functional consultants on executing both new product development and fast\-moving pre\-sales engagements.

This role owns all aspects of demo customization, prioritizing configuration but leveraging Apex, LWCs, and Flows when needed. You’ll partner closely with Saasinct’s product owners, architects, and engineers to showcase the power of our product and service offerings to prospective financial services clients.

**What You’ll Be Doing**

* Work with customers and client stakeholders to understand and define business requirements. Create user stories and functional requirements; ensure assigned projects are accurately tracked, managed, and reported on using Saasinct’s project management tools.
* Implement Salesforce solutions in Sales Cloud, Service Cloud, Financial Services Cloud Communities, and integrating third\-party tools as required. Develop data models and document data structures using visual diagrams and data dictionaries; perform data management and implement data quality best practices.
* Configure features and processes that include custom objects, formula fields, field dependencies, validation rules, workflow rules and actions, approval processes, reporting and dashboards, and other declarative features in Salesforce. Define and configure user security permissions and role hierarchies to meet client requirements.
* Collaborate with Saasinct team members to understand, define and improve current processes and best practices using process flow diagrams, making recommendations for future state processes and system designs.
* Own the evolution of Saasinct’s demo orgs, prioritizing configuration\-first solutions across Sales Cloud, Financial Services Cloud, and Marketing Cloud, using Apex, LWCs, or custom integrations when necessary.
* Translate Product Owners’ high\-level ideas and roadmaps into detailed solutions, build tasks, and phased releases, holding regular syncs with stakeholders to review backlog, confirm demo readiness, and surface blockers or dependencies.
* Rapidly deliver and iterate demo environment features, accelerating key sales opportunities by seeding realistic data and ensuring end\-to\-end business processes resonate with a variety of financial\-services use cases. Establish and maintain a CI/CD pipeline and rigorous test coverage, enabling controlled deployments, rollback, and reliable environment refreshes while respecting Salesforce data\-security best practices.
* Own day\-to\-day demo\-org administration and technical troubleshooting, supporting Saasinct’s sales team with timely updates. Create clear, reusable documentation, including architecture diagrams, data\-loading scripts, reset instructions, and demo playbooks.

**What You Bring**

* 10\+ years hands\-on Salesforce experience spanning admin and development tasks.
* Current certifications: Administrator and Platform App Builder or Platform Developer I (higher certs a plus).
* Proven track record of building and delivering Salesforce demos or prototypes in pre\-sales contexts.
* Proficiency in Flows, Apex, Lightning Web Components, SOQL/SOSL, API integrations, and DevOps Center/Gearset.
* Strong discovery, presentation, and storytelling skills—able to quantify ROI and handle technical objections.
* Financial service experience

**Nice To Have**

* Private\-equity and broad capital\-markets domain expertise highly preferred.
* Experience with Salesforce Data Cloud and AI features (Einstein, Agentforce) in demo scenarios.

**This is a contract to hire position.**

Job Type: Contract

Pay: $75\.00 \- $150\.00 per hour

Work Location: Remote

title: Site Inspector
description:
Since 2007, Accena SWPPP Services has partnered with construction contractors, developers, and excavators delivering expert Stormwater Pollution Prevention.

Ours is a small niche where the EPA and Utah require construction sites to be inspected on a bi\-weekly basis and after .25" of rain to verify the mitigations and controls to prevent dirt, mud, and debris from running off the site are installed and still functioning as intended.

You must be responsible, dependable, and able to perform your duties with little supervision. You also need your own reliable vehicle and a clean driving record. You will be paid as a 1099 independent contractor.

We provide training and what is needed to complete the inspections.

The current inspection site is located at:

2\. East Side of Bear Lake: 41°59'13\.5"N 111°15'51\.5"W

Each inspection typically takes less than 30 minutes. After the inspection, a short electronic report will need to be sent to our office with your findings.

To qualify, you will need to complete the free EPA online 8\-hour course for stormwater inspectors within a week of being hired. We will provide additional personal training and will walk you through the first inspection (s).

We will pay **$120 for taking and passing the course** and then **$100 per inspection (twice per month including your gas and time) plus $75 for extra drive\-by inspections after .25" of rain** (you will be notified by email when the rain reaches .25"). You are responsible for your vehicle and gas.

We are hiring immediately.

*FYI: Anytime someone seeks an application for development or construction, there are EPA and Utah regulatory requirements to ensure appropriate measures are in place, such as a silt fence and storm drain covers, to make sure dirt and other pollutants aren’t entering storm drains and then directly into our rivers.*

*Before construction starts, builders and developers are required to make sure there is a Stormwater Pollution Prevention Plan (SWPPP) in place to prevent stormwater pollution. Our team develops SWPPPs for our clients.*

*The No. 1 cause of stormwater pollution is sediment that is carried into streams, rivers, and lakes along with other pollutants which can kill fish and other aquatic life and cause the growth of harmful algae.*

*During the active construction process, the site must be inspected at least twice per month and after rain events to verify the stormwater controls are performing as intended.*

Job Type: Contract

Pay: $200\.00 \- $275\.00 per month

Application Question(s):

* Do you have access to a vehicle to drive to and from the inspection site?
* The law requires that the inspections must take place at 14 day intervals. Can you inspect the site on the same day of the week, every two weeks?
* Do you recognize this is a short\-term "gig" job? Please do not apply if you are looking for a full or part\-time job.

Work Location: On the road

title: Solicitation Development Specialist
description:

The ideal candidate will possess a current knowledge of business trends, government regulations, and software licensing practices. This role involves collaborating with Subject Matter Experts (SMEs) and various departments, including IT and Legal, to ensure that solicitation documents are comprehensive, compliant, and effectively meet program needs. The specialist will rely on their experience and judgment to plan and accomplish goals, working under limited supervision with considerable latitude for initiative.  

  

**Job Type: Contract (Corp to Corp/C2C or 1099\)**  

**Job Location: Austin, TX (Hybrid \- Mondays, Tuesdays, Wednesdays Onsite)**  

  

**Program will only allow candidates who are LOCAL TO THE AUSTIN AREA ONLY.**  

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Actively coordinate and participate in the editorial duties for the development of solicitation packages.
* Collaborate with HHSC Subject Matter Experts (SMEs) on the inclusion of program\-specific information for procurement documents.
* Provide high\-level technical assistance to Medicaid \& Chip Services (MCS), HHSC IT, and other staff regarding procurement processes and approaches.
* Coordinate, organize, and analyze procurement requirements from multiple program areas within MCS and partner departments.
* Work closely with Procurement and Contracting Services (PCS) and Legal Services staff to determine appropriate solicitation methods, timelines, and manage the procurement process.
* Serve as an SME in assigned workgroups and training activities, including developing presentations for management and staff.
* Effectively find manufacturers for technology products or services, ensure order fulfillment with vendors, and negotiate pricing and delivery schedules.


  

**Qualifications and Experience**  

**Must have Requirements**
* 5 Years: Experience drafting **Requests for Proposals (RFPs) within state health agencies.**
* 5 Years: Experience leading **Joint Application Design (JAD)** sessions to elicit requirements from stakeholders.
* 5 Years: Experience developing **key performance measures** for solicitations and resulting contracts.


  

**Preferred Qualifications**
* 5 Years: Experience in **Texas Medicaid.**
* 5 Years: Experience creating process flows for AS\-IS and TO\-BE models.
* 5 Years: Experience developing cost models, pricing workbooks, and financial requirements.
* 5 Years: Prior experience developing Federal funding requests (Planning and/or Implementation Advanced Planning Documents).
* 5 Years: Knowledge of the State of Texas Procurement and Contract Management Guide.
* 5 Years: Experience negotiating large contracts.
* 5 Years: Experience performing quality assurance activities on large projects.


  

**General Requirements**
* 4\-7 years of experience in the field or in a related area.
* Familiarity with standard concepts, practices, and procedures within the procurement field.
* A certain degree of creativity and latitude is required to plan and accomplish goals.
* Ability to work under limited supervision with considerable latitude for the use of initiative and independent judgment.


  

**Certifications (Preferred)**

title: QA Analyst
description:
**ASSYST** is seeking a detail\-oriented and experienced **QA Analyst** to join our direct client's technology team in **Boca Raton, FL.**  

  

This role is responsible for ensuring the delivery of high\-quality software applications by developing and executing comprehensive test plans, with a strong focus on test automation. The ideal candidate will be proficient in creating and maintaining automation frameworks, writing test scripts for web and mobile platforms, and analyzing quality metrics to drive continuous improvement. You will act as an internal quality consultant, collaborating closely with developers and business partners to identify and resolve issues.  

  

**Job Type: Contract (Corp to Corp/C2C or 1099\)**  

**Job Location: Boca Raton, Florida (Fully Onsite role. No remote allowed)**  

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Test Strategy \& Execution: Develop and execute formal test plans, test strategies, and test cases to ensure software quality.
* Automation Framework: Create, maintain, and enhance the test automation framework for both web and mobile applications.
* Scripting \& Automation: Author, execute, and maintain automated test scripts using modern tools and programming languages.
* Backend \& API Testing: Perform in\-depth backend database testing and validation using SQL, as well as comprehensive testing of web services (APIs).
* Defect Management: Diligently document all problems, track defects through their lifecycle, and collaborate with development teams to ensure timely resolution.
* CI/CD Integration: Create, manage, and execute automated test jobs through CI/CD pipelines using tools like Jenkins.
* Quality Metrics \& Reporting: Define, track, and analyze quality assurance metrics such as defect counts, test results, and test status to evaluate and improve software processes.
* Collaboration \& Mentorship: Work closely with developers to resolve product glitches or design issues, and act as a subject matter expert, potentially coaching junior technical staff.
* Process Improvement: Perform quality audits across IT functions to ensure adherence to quality standards, procedures, and methodologies.


  

**Required Qualifications**
* Education: Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or a related field. Equivalent professional experience will be considered.
* Overall Experience: 5\-7 years of experience in software testing, with a strong emphasis on backend database testing and test automation.
* A minimum of 3 years in a systems development or business\-related role.
* Web Services Testing: A minimum of 2 years of hands\-on experience testing web services.
* Database Skills: Solid understanding and practical experience with SQL.
* Experience with data visualization and reporting using Power BI.
* Automation Frameworks: Minimum of 1 year of experience with modern automation tools like Playwright or similar.
* Automation Tooling: Hands\-on experience with QA automation tools, preferably from the SmartBear suite (ReadyAPI, LoadUI, TestComplete, BitBar) and Selenium WebDriver.
* Programming/Scripting: Good understanding of Groovy and/or Java scripting, with a clear grasp of Object\-Oriented Programming (OOP) principles.
* CI/CD \& Build Tools: Experience creating and managing jobs in Jenkins, with a clear understanding of build tools like Maven or Gradle.
* Core Competencies: Proven data analysis, data verification, and problem\-solving abilities. Exceptional attention to detail and the ability to balance multiple concurrent tasks.
* Experience with cloud platforms and services, particularly Microsoft Azure.


  

*ASSYST is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, disability, military status, national origin or any other characteristic protected under federal, state, or applicable local law*

title: Remote: Learning & Development/Instructional Design Advisor
description:
Description: **Overview**


We’re seeking an experienced learning and development professional who is passionate about making a significant impact across diverse sectors, including the Federal Government, non\-profit, and commercial industries. Ideal candidates will possess a Master’s degree and over 6 years of experience in crafting, developing, and deploying educational content within environments such as higher education, human resources, or corporate training. While consulting experience is a bonus, it's not mandatory.


We are an innovative, fast\-paced boutique consulting firm with a highly collaborative and supportive human\-centered culture. We value experienced, creative, and proactive problem solvers who thrive in a collaborative setting. As a new member of our team, you will dive into a variety of projects, working both as part of a team and independently on critical deliverables. We seek individuals who are not only strategic thinkers but also meticulous executors. Ideal candidates are robust communicators who are open to continuous feedback, iteration, and adaptation, ready to tackle challenges head\-on and drive meaningful change.

**About Us**


Frontier Design partners with brave leaders to imagine and build what’s next across the U.S. Government, with leading AI labs, for Fortune 500 firms, and in partnership with non\-profits, universities and foundations. We build:

* Learning and development experiences that transform organizations
* Secure and responsible AI models
* Measurable impact for mission\-driven organizations
* Data tools that surface actionable insight


Our L/D practice inspires clients to unlock learner potential, unleash workforces, break through boundaries and transform skillsets. We specialize in :

* **Learning Strategy:** We build human\-centered learning ecosystems that grow talent and become a force of transformation
* **Curriculum Design:** We design curriculum for real people doing real work so capabilities and confidence grow at every level
* **Leadership Development:** Great leadership doesn’t just happen \- we cultivate it by igniting self\-awareness and deepening influence, equipping leaders to shape what’s next
* **Expert Facilitation:** With expert facilitation, we create the conditions for collaboration, trust and transformative breakthroughs
* **Learning Assessment:** We illuminate learning impact, uncover growth opportunities, and inform smart, strategic decisions that move people and mission forward
* **Future\-Ready Learning Systems**: We integrate learning management tools, AI, and digital platforms to ensure every employee has access to high\-quality, meaningful development opportunities


Our interdisciplinary team is creative and analytical, combining our expertise as engineers, instructional designers, evaluators, strategists, innovators and storytellers. We believe in delivering *radical value*, delighting our clients with exceptional quality and wowing them with our cost\-effectiveness. Our company culture sets us apart from our peers, unleashing colleagues to be their best selves – bold, empowered leaders with a lot of heart!

* We work globally and locally in the U.S., with a wide variety of world\-class organizations across industries including federal and state governments, non\-profit organizations, academia, foundations and the private sector. While headquartered in Alexandria, VA, our organizational construct is largely “virtual”, which offers us the opportunity to employ remarkable talent regardless of physical location. For team members in the Washington, DC area, we utilize shared office spaces for in\-person meetings as needed. To learn more about Frontier Design please visit www.imaginefrontier.com


Requirements:**Frontier Instructional Designer Roles, Responsibilities \& Requirements**
===========================================================================

**Required Education and Experience**

* Master's Degree in Instructional Design or Instructional Technology, Learning Design and Technology, Educational Technology, Learning Sciences, Curriculum and Instruction, Human Resource Development with a focus on Instructional Design, or equivalent or Certified Professional in Learning and Performance (CPLP), Certified Instructional Designer/Developer (CIDD), Certified Instructional Designer (C.I.D.).
* 6\+ years of experience in designing, developing, and implementing instructional content focused on adult learning within settings such as higher education, human resources, or corporate environments.

**Responsibilities**


Learning and Development and Instructional Design

* Design, develop, and implement instructional content focused on adult learning within settings such as higher education, human resources, or corporate environments.
* Evaluate the effectiveness of learning interventions and making data\-driven improvements based on feedback and performance data. This could include conducting needs assessments, learner evaluations, or program evaluations.
* Design and develop a range of learning materials, including e\-learning modules, instructor\-led training materials, videos, simulations, and interactive activities.
* Conduct thorough needs assessments to identify learning gaps and performance objectives across different sectors and organizations.
* Employ various instructional design models and theories, such as ADDIE (Analysis, Design, Development, Implementation, Evaluation), SAM (Successive Approximation Model), and adult learning principles like Andragogy to develop curriculums and learning programs.
* Develop and deliver digital learning solutions using e\-learning authoring tools (e.g., Articulate Storyline, Adobe Captivate, or similar) and learning management systems (LMS).
* Manage instructional design projects from initiation to completion, including setting timelines, managing resources, and coordinating with stakeholders.
* Utilize evaluation and assessment methods to measure the effectiveness and impact of learning interventions and make data\-driven improvements.


Client Service and Delivery

* Lead client engagements and a portfolio of projects, providing radical value, innovative solutions and exceeding client expectations in a timely manner.
* Provide leadership and quality control and guide teams to work efficiently and effectively to maximize client delight, value, and overall impact.
* Plan and monitor projects effectively through the successful management of project staffing hours and budgets, and managing and communicating workloads of team members, resulting in a positive working experience and high value for clients.
* Empathetically conceptualize conversations so that clients feel heard and understood and the project aligns with client contexts and goals.
* Hold expertise lightly, incorporating feedback and collaborating with colleagues, and adapting approaches and solutions as needed.

**Required Skills and Mindsets**


Learning and Development and Instructional Design

* Ability to conduct thorough needs assessments to identify learning gaps and performance objectives across different sectors and organizations.
* Proficiency in various instructional design models and theories, such as ADDIE (Analysis, Design, Development, Implementation, Evaluation), SAM (Successive Approximation Model), and adult learning principles like Andragogy.
* Familiarity with e\-learning authoring tools (e.g., Articulate Storyline, Adobe Captivate, or similar) and learning management systems (LMS) to develop and deliver digital learning solutions.
* Ability to manage instructional design projects from initiation to completion, including setting timelines, managing resources, and coordinating with stakeholders.
* Knowledge of evaluation and assessment methods to measure the effectiveness and impact of learning interventions and make data\-driven improvements.


Collaboration and Client Engagement

* Collaborating with cross\-functional teams, subject matter experts, and stakeholders from diverse backgrounds and working effectively in interdisciplinary environments and adapting to different organizational cultures and client needs.
* Willingness and ability to adapt instructional design strategies and approaches to meet the unique needs and constraints of diverse projects and organizations.
* Sensitivity to cultural and diversity considerations when designing learning materials for diverse audiences across different sectors and organizations.
* Creativity in developing engaging, effective, and cutting\-edge training programs that meet the evolving needs of learners and organizations.


Other

* Desire and commitment to continuous learning and professional development in the field of instructional design. This could include participation in professional associations, certifications, conferences, or ongoing training programs.
* Must be based in the United States.

**Type of Position**


This role is being offered on a flexible basis, and we are open to engaging the right candidate in one of two ways:

**W\-2 Hourly Employee**

* Hired as an hourly employee of Frontier Design
* Eligible for company benefits and performance\-based bonuses
* Expected to collaborate closely with the Frontier team, participate in internal processes, and contribute to long\-term client and firm success
* Position is remote, with occasional travel for client engagements

**1099 Independent Contractor**

* Engaged as an independent professional, providing services to Frontier Design under a contract agreement
* Responsible for determining how services are performed, consistent with agreed\-upon project deliverables
* Not eligible for company benefits or employee\-based bonuses
* Engagement is project\-based; work is performed remotely, though some projects may require occasional client travel
* Contractor must be legally authorized to work in the United States

**Compensation**

* **If W\-2 hourly**: Equivalent to **$43–$65/hour** (aligned with an annualized salary of $90,000–$135,000\), with eligibility for performance\-based bonuses and benefits.
* **If 1099 contractor**: Approximately **$55–$80/hour**, depending on experience and project scope.


There is no set cap on hours and we expect to be extremely busy for the next 6 months; opportunities may expand as new projects and client engagements arise.

description:

title: Remote Estimator w/ Comm'l & Government Project Experience for 'FREELANCE ASSIGNMENTS'
description:
**Job Description: Project\-Based Estimator (Remote)**

**Position Type:** Freelance / As Needed

**Compensation:** $50 per completed estimate

**Location:** Remote (Projects based in AL, FL, GA, NC, SC)

**How to Apply**

Interested candidates should submit a resume and brief summary of relevant estimating experience to:

**Email:** Juanita@ltd\-cms.com

**Subject Line:** Project\-Based Estimator Application – \[Your Name]

**OR**

Click this **LINK to Apply:** **https://jobs.gusto.com/postings/ltd\-construction\-management\-services\-inc\-remote\-estmator\-fc20f8d6\-b109\-4f83\-ac88\-e93b25fd1841 (include cover letter)**

**About LTD Construction Management \& Services, Inc.** LTD Construction Management \& Services, Inc. is a trusted provider of construction support, janitorial services, and repair work across the Southeastern United States. We deliver hands\-on solutions for government, public and private sector clients, with a focus on site services, and operational execution. Our scopes include make\-ready unit preparation, facility maintenance, painting, construction cleaning, and light repairs—always tailored to meet project demands with precision and reliability.

As we expand our footprint, we seek experienced estimators to support pricing and bid development for a variety of scopes including government, commercial, and private sector projects. Estimators will contribute to cost proposals across multiple service lines, ensuring accuracy, market alignment, and compliance with municipal and county RFP standards.

**Role Summary**

The Project\-Based Estimator will produce accurate, scope\-aligned cost estimates for projects in trades such as painting, demolition, construction cleaning, and light construction services. This remote role is ideal for independent professionals with strong estimating experience and a flexible schedule.

**Key Responsibilities**

* Review project documentation including drawings, specifications, and site photos
* Develop detailed cost estimates based on labor, materials, and scope requirements
* Align estimates with public sector bid formats when applicable
* Collaborate with project leads to clarify conditions and ensure scope accuracy
* Submit completed estimates on deadline; compensation issued per approved estimate

**Qualifications**

* Proven experience estimating construction projects in one or more sectors:
* Government/public sector (e.g., municipal RFPs, housing authorities)
* Commercial (e.g., retail, office, hospitality renovations)
* Private residential or developer\-led work
* Ability to interpret bid documents and prepare professional pricing summaries
* Familiarity with regional labor rates and material cost trends
* Strong communication and organizational skills
* Proficiency with digital tools (Excel, Bluebeam, PlanSwift, or similar)
* Experience with proposal formatting and compliance preferred

**Additional Details**

* Remote position with flexible hours based on project flow
* Paid at $50 per approved estimate
* No minimum commitment; work assigned on a per\-project basis
* Ideal for freelance estimators, retired professionals, or consultants seeking flexible engagement

**Turnaround Expectations**

Project\-Based Estimators are expected to deliver pricing estimates within **24 to 72 hours** of receiving complete scope documentation, depending on project complexity. Urgent requests may require same\-day turnaround, while multi\-line scopes with layered requirements may allow up to three business days. Timely, accurate, and evaluator\-friendly submissions are essential to LTD’s proposal strategy.

Job Type: Contract

Pay: From $50\.00 per day

Work Location: Remote

title: US Tax Advisor for Individual Income Tax - Product Development Consultant (Remote)
description:
Join a Growing FinTech Startup \- International Tax Technology

Are you a US Tax Professional ready to work with cutting\-edge technology? We're building innovative tax solutions for US expatriates and international professionals.

About the Opportunity

\- Remote position with flexible schedule  
\- Part\-time start (\~20h/week) with growth potential  
\- Freelance to employee transition opportunity  
\- Product development focus \- help build something new  
\- Work with modern tech stack and AI\-powered solutions

What You'll Do

Phase 1 (Development \- Primary Focus):

\- Define Individual Income Tax Logic and Requirements: Provide the critical tax information, business rules, and compliance logic that our software will be built upon. This is the core "flow" of data and decisions the application must handle.  
\- Ensure IRS Compliance: Validate that all defined tax workflows, calculations, and outputs adhere to current IRS regulations.  
\- Collaborate with the Product Team: Work with UX designers and developers to ensure the application's user journey ("user flow") accurately reflects the necessary tax preparation steps.  
\- Quality Assurance: Test and verify the accuracy of the software's tax calculations and data processing.  
\- Guide E\-Filing Specifications (preferred): Provide expert guidance on requirements and specifications for integrating with IRS e\-file systems.

Phase 2 (Service Delivery):

\- Provide tax preparation services to international clients  
\- Handle expatriate tax scenarios  
\- Support customer success initiatives

Required Qualifications

\- 2\+ years US tax preparation experience  
\- Individual tax filing expertise: Forms 1040, 2555, 1116, 8938, 8833, FBAR, etc.  
\- IRS e\-filing access (preferred) or ability to obtain  
\- International/expatriate tax experience  
\- E\-filing platform knowledge (preferred) (TurboTax, Sprintax, etc.)  
\- Startup mindset \- adaptable and solution\-oriented  
\- Available for collaboration hours with European team (flexible)

Preferred Qualifications

\- CPA, EA, or tax professional certification  
\- Experience with tax software workflows  
\- Interest in technology and automation  
\- Multilingual capabilities a plus

Why Join Us

✅ Shape the product from early stage

✅ International tax focus \- complex, interesting cases

✅ Modern startup environment with growth opportunities

✅ Flexible remote work with supportive team

✅ Professional development in fintech space

Ideal Candidate

You're a skilled tax professional who:

\- Enjoys working on complex international tax situations  
\- Wants to influence product development  
\- Thrives in startup environments  
\- Values flexibility and growth potential

\-\-\-

How to Apply

Send us:

1\. Resume with US tax experience highlights  
2\. Brief note about your interest in tax technology  
3\. Availability for part\-time consulting

Subject: US Tax Advisor Application

\-\-\-

\*Equal opportunity employer building diverse teams.\*

Perfect for: Experienced tax preparers \| International tax specialists \| Tech\-curious professionals seeking growth

Job Type: Contract

Application Question(s):

* Are you familiar with e\-filing software?
* How many years of experience do you have as a US tax Advisor ?

Work Location: Remote

title: Apartment Maintenance Technician - Stony Creek I & II (PART-TIME)
description:
Buckingham Property Management has an immediate opening for an experienced **Apartment Maintenance Technician** ensuring superior curb\-appeal, timely and quality unit turns and overall maintenance of multi\-resident Affordable Housing apartment community(ies) at its **Stony Creek I \& II property in Williams, California!**

**AS A CONDITION OF EMPLOYMENT, the selected individual will be REQUIRED TO LIVE ON THE PREMISES in Company\-provided housing (2 Bedroom)** to respond to after\-hours emergency situations at the property, as directed by the District Supervisor and/or Director of Property Management. After\-hours is generally defined as between 5:00 p.m. and 8:00 a.m. during weekdays and from 5:00 p.m. Friday evening until 8:00 a.m. Monday morning unless on approved paid sick leave for sick leave eligible reasons, or when timely requested and approved under Buckingham’s vacation policy, or when on an approved leave of absence.

The selected individual will be granted a license to use an apartment unit at the property subject to California occupancy restrictions. The license granted will be for temporary residential purposes only, in direct conjunction with, and concurrently with, employment as a condition of employment. As an employee required to live on premises in Company\-provided housing as a condition of employment, the selected individual will be a licensee only and will not be a tenant at the property.

The selected individual will be responsible for arranging and paying for all utilities but will not be charged rent and no amount of rent will be deducted from any paycheck for the licensed use of an apartment unit. However, the requisite portion of the fair market value of the licensed unit is subject to California Unemployment Insurance/ETT and SDI taxes but is not subject to federal or state income taxes, FICA, or FUTA because (a) the apartment unit is furnished on Buckingham Property Management’s premises; (b) the apartment unit is furnished for Buckingham Property Management’s convenience; and (c) you are required to live on premises in Company\-provided housing as a condition of employment.

**HOUSING PROVIDED AS A CONDITION OF EMPLOYMENT IS NOT A FORM OF COMPENSATION AND IS NOT A FRINGE BENEFIT FOR ANY EMPLOYEE. IT IS ONLY PROVIDED FOR THE CONVENIENCE AND BENEFIT OF BUCKINGHAM PROPERTY MANAGEMENT.**

A person in this position works in partnership with the Community Manager, other Maintenance Technician(s), Maintenance Lead (if assigned) in the completion of requested service and/or maintenance work in accordance with Company standards. Works with outside contractors (as appropriate) to ensure the preservation of assigned property(ies).

The selected individual will have at least two (2\) years of experiencein commonly used practices and procedures in the maintenance field; and working knowledge of basic maintenance repairs and troubleshooting, completion of work orders and turnover of vacant units in preparation for quality move\-ins.

**While other duties may be added, the Essential Duties and Responsibilities of the position include:** 

* Adheres to established work schedule and property schedule, including but not limited to, daily Zoom meeting, daily property walk\-through with Community Manager and/or Maintenance Lead (if assigned) to maximize curb appeal, overall community appearance, and preservation of client asset; reports issues immediately and makes recommendations for improvement to District Supervisor and/or Director of Property Management;
* Responds to after\-hours emergency situations at the property, as directed by the District Supervisor and/or Director of Property Management;
* Works as a professional partner with the Community Manager and District Supervisor ensuring daily communication as to status of priorities at property and all issues that may need support either via email or via the daily Zoom meeting;
* Physically walks the property on a daily and frequent basis to maximize curb appeal and overall community appearance. Completes necessary cleaning; pulls weeds and removes litter, debris, cigarette butts and pet droppings from the grounds particularly ensuring that the following areas are neat and clean at all times: community office, pool area, laundry rooms, stairways and breezeways, dumpster areas, recreation areas, grounds adjacent to the road and in front of the community office, walkways to and from, and in\-between buildings, parking lots and drives.
* Physically walks the property on a daily and frequent basis and cleans and rakes shrub areas; shovels mud when necessary. Uses blower to keep sidewalks and walking areas clean of loose grass and brush. Checks exterior light fixtures daily and addresses issues immediately.
* Completes various physical tasks as necessary (e.g., tearing down fences, digging post holes, climbing multiple flights of stairs, carrying buckets of paint, carrying sheetrock, lumber and flooring materials, carrying abandoned sofas, etc.)
* Partners with Community Manager and/or Maintenance Lead (if assigned) in the scheduling of quality, prompt and professional response to service requests from residents such as:

o **Plumbing:** clearing stoppages and replacing fittings, replacing fixtures, fittings, valves, and garbage disposals;

o **General Carpentry:** wallboard repair, countertop/cabinet replacement, finish carpentry, door/lock repair, ceramic tile repair, fitting doors, freeing window and door jams, and light woodwork;

o **Basic Electrical Repairs:** appliances, air conditioning, heating, light fixtures, switches, outlets, ballasts and circuits;

o **Custodial:** sweeping, mopping, vacuuming, carpet shampooing, emptying community trash bins, cleaning windows, laundry and community room maintenance, and the cleaning of units;

* Partners with Community Manager, Maintenance Lead (if assigned) in the scheduling/completion of unit turns to ensure units are “rent ready” (including but not limited to painting, cleaning and repairing) within 7\-10 days of move\-out; communicates obstacles affecting timely completion of turns to District Supervisor in a timely manner;
* Performs detailed cleaning as necessary, including but not limited to, washing exterior buildings, cleaning amenities, community rooms, building windows, laundry rooms, common area restrooms, fitness rooms, pool area and BBQ areas.
* Performs "trash\-out" duties at vacated units on a daily basis. Removes all abandoned furniture, trash, boxes, etc. Transfers trash and other items left outside of dumpster into dumpster or storage area, whichever is applicable. Keeps dumpster/compactor doors closed at all times.
* Responsible for daily cleanup of trash, trash bins, and loose debris, and disposes of any waste according to safety guidelines. Pressure washes common areas and trash areas monthly.
* Cleans and maintains storage and maintenance shop areas and ensures that both remain locked when not in use. Conducts monthly physical inventory of materials, and timely requesting appropriate tools, equipment and supplies.
* Performs work area clean\-up and practices proper safety protocol at all times.
* Identifies and resolves safety hazards throughout the community, including but not limited to burnt out lights, trip hazards, broken sprinkler heads, pools of water.
* Immediately reports and/or initiates action to correct unsafe conditions to the Community Manager and District Supervisor. If timely response does not occur, reports unsafe conditions to Director of Property Management.
* Maintains accurate record keeping of preventative maintenance, work orders, large replacements (e.g. carpet or appliance replacements), annual inspections, and large capital projects (e.g. HVAC replacement, asphalt, etc.)
* Prepares for and participates in regulatory audits and/or inspections;
* Performs and/or participates in monthly, quarterly and annual inspections of units, buildings, and/or common areas, as required;
* Performs scheduled maintenance on all equipment in accordance with manufacturer's recommendations and operating manuals;
* Ensures security of property assets, including but not limited to: office, laundry room, pool, community room and buildings by setting appropriate alarm systems and/or setting appropriate locks;

**OTHER SKILLS, ABILITIES OR QUALIFICATIONS**

* Experience and understanding of basic plumbing, electrical and/or appliance repairs, preferred.
* Ability to read and interpret equipment operating manuals and instructions guides. Ability to read and understand Company policies and procedures.
* Ability to resolve maintenance and service issues quickly and in a quality manner.

**COMPUTER HARDWARE AND SOFTWARE APPLICATIONS, EQUIPMENT, MACHINERY, OR TOOLS A PERSON IN THIS JOB MUST USE IN THE PERFORMANCE OF THE JOB DUTIES:**

* Desktop computer
* Company\-provided cell phone
* **SOFTWARE**: YARDI
* **SOFTWARE**: ADP Automated Timekeeping
* Hand tools and power tools

Buckingham will supply and take care of all tools and equipment that are required by Buckingham or are necessary to do the job unless an employee makes at least twice the California minimum wage and that employee works in a recognized trade or craft, in which case the employee may be required to provide and care for all hand (not power) tools and equipment usually necessary for that type of job. All tools furnished by Buckingham must be returned by employee upon termination of employment.

**BUSINESS TRAVEL REQUIREMENTS**

BPM reasonably expects driving to be one of the job functions for this position, therefore, qualified applicants must have reliable transportation for business travel purposes.

* Travel requirements are of a local nature (within 100 miles) up to ¼ of time.
* Employees are reimbursed for the approved use of their personal automobile on official Buckingham business.
* Employee who are required to use their personal automobiles for business travel **must provide evidence of liability insurance coverage as well as evidence of and maintenance of a valid driver’s license** upon hire and in accordance with Buckingham policy.

**SCHEDULE AND COMPENSATION**

While the typical schedule for a person in this position is 24 hours per week (Monday, Wednesday, and Friday: 8\-5 p.m. with a one\-hour lunch generally between 12\-1 p.m.), **plus after\-hours emergency response** required of a person who is required to live on premises in Company\-provided housing as a condition of employment, additional hours may be available and/or necessary on holidays and during evenings and/or weekends, according to the needs of the business.

Compensation for this **PART\-TIME**, hourly non\-exempt position is **$23\.00 \- $23\.00 per hour**.

**TO APPLY FOR THIS POSITION**, submit an Employment Application to careers@buckinghampm.com. *Picture files will not be accepted so please ensure that application materials are submitted as PDF files.*

While resumes and cover letters may be submitted, as well, all applicants are required to submit an Employment Application. **NO PHONE CALLS PLEASE.**

*All employment offers are “conditional” upon successful completion of all pre\-employment requirements including, but not limited to, post\-offer/pre\-employment criminal background check, credit report (permissible under California Labor Code section 1024\.5 if you are applying for or work in a position that affords regular access to bank or credit card account information, Social Security numbers, and dates of birth), verification of previous employment, motor vehicle report (if applicable to the position), and/or reference checks.*

*Unless or until an offer of employment has no contingencies or conditions, you should not take any action that could result in financial loss if a conditional offer is withdrawn, such as giving notice of intent to terminate your current employment, selling real estate, or incurring any other costs associated with accepting employment with Buckingham Property Management. No such activity should be undertaken until after you have been informed by Buckingham Property Management that an employment offer is no longer conditional.*

*Buckingham Property Management will consider qualified applicants for employment who have criminal histories in a manner consistent with applicable laws.*

*Buckingham Property Management will provide reasonable accommodation to any applicant who needs assistance in completing our employment application. If you need an accommodation due to a disability, please contact us about your interest in employment at* careers@buckinghampm.com*. Alternatively, you can call us at (559\) 801\-0730\. NOTE: This email address and phone number is not for general employment inquiries.*

*Buckingham Property Management’s policy is to fill every position without regard to* race (including hair texture and protective hairstyles), color, national origin (including language use restrictions and possession of a driver's license issued to persons unable to prove their presence in the United States is authorized under federal law), ancestry, religion (including religious dress and grooming practices), sex/gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, breastfeeding or related medical conditions), sex stereotype, gender identity/gender expression/transgender (including whether or not you are transitioning or have transitioned) and sexual orientation, reproductive health decision\-making, physical or mental disability, medical condition, genetic information/characteristics, marital status/registered domestic partner status, age (40 and over), military or veteran status, use of cannabis/marijuana off the job and away from the workplace; and or any other basis protected by federal, state or local law or ordinance or regulation.

*Buckingham Property Management maintains a Drug\-Free Workplace.*

***BUCKINGHAM PROPERTY MANAGEMENT IS FULLY COMMITTED TO FRAUD PREVENTION AND DETECTION*** *and therefore relies upon the employees it hires in following through on that commitment.*

*\*This Job Posting does not necessarily represent an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, skills, duties, requirements, or competencies associated with this job. While this Job Posting is intended to be an accurate reflection of the current job, management reserves the right to revise the job or to require that other or different tasks be performed when circumstances change without formal revision of the Job Posting. This Job Posting replaces all previous Job Postings for this position.*

*Buckingham Property Management reserves the right, at any time, with or without notice, to alter or change job responsibilities and/or work schedules, reassign or transfer job positions, or assign additional job responsibilities based upon the needs of the Company.* 

Job Type: Part\-time

Pay: $23\.00 per hour

Expected hours: 24 per week

Work Location: In person

* Cleans and maintains storage and maintenance shop areas and ensures that both remain locked when not in use. Conducts monthly physical inventory of materials, and timely requesting appropriate tools, equipment and supplies.
* Performs work area clean\-up and practices proper safety protocol at all times.
* Identifies and resolves safety hazards throughout the community, including but not limited to burnt out lights, trip hazards, broken sprinkler heads, pools of water.
* Immediately reports and/or initiates action to correct unsafe conditions to the Community Manager and District Supervisor. If timely response does not occur, reports unsafe conditions to Director of Property Management.
* Maintains accurate record keeping of preventative maintenance, work orders, large replacements (e.g. carpet or appliance replacements), annual inspections, and large capital projects (e.g. HVAC replacement, asphalt, etc.)
* Prepares for and participates in regulatory audits and/or inspections;
* Performs and/or participates in monthly, quarterly and annual inspections of units, buildings, and/or common areas, as required;
* Performs scheduled maintenance on all equipment in accordance with manufacturer's recommendations and operating manuals;
* Ensures security of property assets, including but not limited to: office, laundry room, pool, community room and buildings by setting appropriate alarm systems and/or setting appropriate locks;

**OTHER SKILLS, ABILITIES OR QUALIFICATIONS**

* Experience and understanding of basic plumbing, electrical and/or appliance repairs, preferred.
* Ability to read and interpret equipment operating manuals and instructions guides. Ability to read and understand Company policies and procedures.
* Ability to resolve maintenance and service issues quickly and in a quality manner.

**COMPUTER HARDWARE AND SOFTWARE APPLICATIONS, EQUIPMENT, MACHINERY, OR TOOLS A PERSON IN THIS JOB MUST USE IN THE PERFORMANCE OF THE JOB DUTIES:**

* Desktop computer
* Company\-provided cell phone
* **SOFTWARE**: YARDI
* **SOFTWARE**: ADP Automated Timekeeping
* Hand tools and power tools

Buckingham will supply and take care of all tools and equipment that are required by Buckingham or are necessary to do the job unless an employee makes at least twice the California minimum wage and that employee works in a recognized trade or craft, in which case the employee may be required to provide and care for all hand (not power) tools and equipment usually necessary for that type of job. All tools furnished by Buckingham must be returned by employee upon termination of employment.

**BUSINESS TRAVEL REQUIREMENTS**

BPM reasonably expects driving to be one of the job functions for this position, therefore, qualified applicants must have reliable transportation for business travel purposes.

* Travel requirements are of a local nature (within 100 miles) up to ¼ of time.
* Employees are reimbursed for the approved use of their personal automobile on official Buckingham business.
* Employee who are required to use their personal automobiles for business travel **must provide evidence of liability insurance coverage as well as evidence of and maintenance of a valid driver’s license** upon hire and in accordance with Buckingham policy.

**SCHEDULE AND COMPENSATION**

While the typical schedule for a person in this position is 24 hours per week (Monday, Wednesday, and Friday: 8\-5 p.m. with a one\-hour lunch generally between 12\-1 p.m.), **plus after\-hours emergency response** required of a person who is required to live on premises in Company\-provided housing as a condition of employment, additional hours may be available and/or necessary on holidays and during evenings and/or weekends, according to the needs of the business.

Compensation for this **PART\-TIME**, hourly non\-exempt position is **$23\.00 \- $23\.00 per hour**.

**TO APPLY FOR THIS POSITION**, submit an Employment Application to careers@buckinghampm.com. *Picture files will not be accepted so please ensure that application materials are submitted as PDF files.*

While resumes and cover letters may be submitted, as well, all applicants are required to submit an Employment Application. **NO PHONE CALLS PLEASE.**

*All employment offers are “conditional” upon successful completion of all pre\-employment requirements including, but not limited to, post\-offer/pre\-employment criminal background check, credit report (permissible under California Labor Code section 1024\.5 if you are applying for or work in a position that affords regular access to bank or credit card account information, Social Security numbers, and dates of birth), verification of previous employment, motor vehicle report (if applicable to the position), and/or reference checks.*

*Unless or until an offer of employment has no contingencies or conditions, you should not take any action that could result in financial loss if a conditional offer is withdrawn, such as giving notice of intent to terminate your current employment, selling real estate, or incurring any other costs associated with accepting employment with Buckingham Property Management. No such activity should be undertaken until after you have been informed by Buckingham Property Management that an employment offer is no longer conditional.*

*Buckingham Property Management will consider qualified applicants for employment who have criminal histories in a manner consistent with applicable laws.*

*Buckingham Property Management will provide reasonable accommodation to any applicant who needs assistance in completing our employment application. If you need an accommodation due to a disability, please contact us about your interest in employment at* careers@buckinghampm.com*. Alternatively, you can call us at (559\) 801\-0730\. NOTE: This email address and phone number is not for general employment inquiries.*

*Buckingham Property Management’s policy is to fill every position without regard to* race (including hair texture and protective hairstyles), color, national origin (including language use restrictions and possession of a driver's license issued to persons unable to prove their presence in the United States is authorized under federal law), ancestry, religion (including religious dress and grooming practices), sex/gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, breastfeeding or related medical conditions), sex stereotype, gender identity/gender expression/transgender (including whether or not you are transitioning or have transitioned) and sexual orientation, reproductive health decision\-making, physical or mental disability, medical condition, genetic information/characteristics, marital status/registered domestic partner status, age (40 and over), military or veteran status, use of cannabis/marijuana off the job and away from the workplace; and or any other basis protected by federal, state or local law or ordinance or regulation.

*Buckingham Property Management maintains a Drug\-Free Workplace.*

***BUCKINGHAM PROPERTY MANAGEMENT IS FULLY COMMITTED TO FRAUD PREVENTION AND DETECTION*** *and therefore relies upon the employees it hires in following through on that commitment.*

*\*This Job Posting does not necessarily represent an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, skills, duties, requirements, or competencies associated with this job. While this Job Posting is intended to be an accurate reflection of the current job, management reserves the right to revise the job or to require that other or different tasks be performed when circumstances change without formal revision of the Job Posting. This Job Posting replaces all previous Job Postings for this position.*

*Buckingham Property Management reserves the right, at any time, with or without notice, to alter or change job responsibilities and/or work schedules, reassign or transfer job positions, or assign additional job responsibilities based upon the needs of the Company.*

title: Information Systems Specialist
description:
**Title: Information Systems Specialist**

Location: San Diego, CA 92101

Duration: 6 Months Temp to Hire

Job Description:

The Information Systems Specialist will be responsible for the support functions for personal computers, peripherals, software, and enterprise applications to include administration, set up, installation, upgrades, troubleshooting, maintenance, and repairs. The primary focus of this position is to provide high quality customer service through technology delivery and maintenance. The candidate selected for this position will be expected to work in\-person in the San Diego office

Job Responsibilities

Provide highly responsive hardware and software support services for computer users; ensure problems are managed and resolved in a timely, professional manner; follow up with users to ensure satisfaction.

Install, configure, test, maintain, upgrade, and troubleshoot workstation computers and peripheral devices; maintain server operating systems and services and ensure network interfaces and connections between system components.

Complete software installations and assist users of various levels of computer sophistication in the operation of a wide variety of new and existing software.

Establish and maintain a variety of user accounts, user\-related network resources, and security access protocols and systems.

Perform routine research, analysis, and problem diagnosis, consult with internal and external technical staff when required, and repair or replace equipment as necessary.

Complete basic or non\-routine repairs at user locations or in a workshop; ensure more complex repairs are accomplished by vendors or outside contractors.

Take obsolete equipment out of service and record asset disposal using established systems.

Serve as backup for other Information Systems staff members in a mutually supportive team environment and respond to system failure and maintenance emergencies.

Provide on\-call, after\-hours support to respond to system and network issues and alerts and perform equipment maintenance.

Experience and Qualifications

A high school diploma supplemented by two years of college coursework or training programs in computer information systems, data processing principles, computer operations, and operating software programs, or a related field. A Bachelor’s degree is desirable.

One to four years of increasingly responsible experience providing hardware and software support services for computer users. Training and/or certification a plus.

Experience providing desktop, server, network, and enterprise application support services for an integrated information system environment.

Demonstrated expertise with the installation, configuration, testing, maintenance, upgrading, and troubleshooting of computer systems, peripheral devices, and network operations.

Demonstrated knowledge of and experience working with Windows and macOS systems.

Experience assisting employees of varying levels of computer expertise; ability to clearly and concisely communicate technical information to staff of all levels of technical sophistication.

Ability to diagnose and repair problems with computers, peripheral devices, and network\-related equipment.

Demonstrated knowledge of and experience with workstation peripherals, switches, routers, 1000BaseT Ethernet, and PC hardware.

Experience compiling and maintaining records, logs, databases, and inventories of computer service\-related information and equipment

Demonstrated ability to lift and move workstations, monitors, and peripherals; ability to use hand tools; ability to crawl beneath desks and tables.

Ability to think logically and analyze technical information, including written manuals, computer/ equipment mechanisms and parts.

Ability to work independently and adhere to prescribed routines and procedures.

Job Type: Temporary

Pay: $32\.00 per hour

Application Question(s):

* Are you comfortable working with 6 Months Temp to Hire?

Education:

* High school or equivalent (Preferred)

Experience:

* Desktop, server, network: 3 years (Required)
* Windows and macOS systems: 3 years (Required)
* switches, routers, 1000BaseT Ethernet: 3 years (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: Structural Engineering Intern
description:
Overview:

We are seeking a highly\-motivated intern to join our Bridges \& Structures Engineering Discipline for Summer 2026 in our Woodcliff Lake, NJ office.  

Colliers Engineering \& Design, an affiliate of Colliers, is a trusted provider of multi\-discipline engineering, design and consulting services to public and private sector clients. Headquartered in Holmdel, New Jersey with 70\+ offices throughout the United States, we specialize in providing a comprehensive suite of services including: civil/site, transportation, MEP (mechanical, electrical \& plumbing) engineering, architecture, geospatial/survey, infrastructure, governmental, geotechnical/environmental, telecommunications and utilities engineering. We employ over 3,000 talented professionals who utilize the most advanced technologies to deliver customized solutions for our clients.
Responsibilities:
* The selected candidate will work in the Northeast Bridges \& Structures group of the Company’s Infrastructure Division on various projects including new or rehabilitated highway, rail and pedestrian bridges and culverts, retaining walls and temporary structures for contractors.
* Responsibilities will include the preparation of a variety of engineering analyses and computations, CAD drawings, technical reports and cost estimates under the supervision of senior engineers.
* Collaborate as a member of the Bridges team to realize project deliverables and deadlines.
* Put classroom lessons to work in a practical, real\-world situation.
* Occasional field work may be required under the supervision of senior engineers or managers.
* Opportunities to experience and participate in the design of structural projects for other related Infrastructure Division departments including Rail, Waterway Structures and Hydro\-power.
* In addition to the work\-centered program, we also offer robust internship programming, which includes opportunities to work with other interns, learn about other areas of the business, and develop valuable communication skills and networking connections.


Qualifications:
* Pursuing a Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Civil Engineering or a related program.
* Interest in Structural design preferred.
* Must have reliable transportation to the office.
* Basic understanding of AutoCAD and/or Microstation preferred.
* Basic understanding of structural analysis software (i.e. ETABS, SAP2000, STAAD, etc.) preferred.
* Possess solid problem\-solving skills.
* Must be able to work in a high\-paced environment.
* Strong computer literacy, to include MS Office.
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
* Ability to read, write, and understand English for purposes of comprehending written job\-related communications and verbal instructions and interactions.


Compensation: $20 to $28 per hour (depending on qualifications)
company_description: Colliers Engineering & Design is a multi-discipline and architecture, consulting and engineering design firm with a unique balance of public and private sector experience.

title: Temporary Technical / ParaPro (Dining Services)
description:
**About Us**
------------



Georgia Tech prides itself on its technological resources, collaborations, high\-quality student body, and its commitment to building an outstanding and diverse community of learning, discovery, and creation. We strongly encourage applicants whose values align with our institutional values, as outlined in our Strategic Plan. These values include academic excellence, diversity of thought and experience, inquiry and innovation, collaboration and community, and ethical behavior and stewardship. Georgia Tech has policies to promote a healthy work\-life balance and is aware that attracting faculty may require meeting the needs of two careers.  

  

**About Georgia Tech**  

Georgia Tech is a top\-ranked public research university situated in the heart of Atlanta, a diverse and vibrant city with numerous economic and cultural strengths. The Institute serves more than 45,000 students through top\-ranked undergraduate, graduate, and executive programs in engineering, computing, science, business, design, and liberal arts. Georgia Tech's faculty attracted more than $1\.4 billion in research awards this past year in fields ranging from biomedical technology to artificial intelligence, energy, sustainability, semiconductors, neuroscience, and national security. Georgia Tech ranks among the nation's top 20 universities for research and development spending and No. 1 among institutions without a medical school.  

  

**Georgia Tech's Mission and Values**  

Georgia Tech's mission is to develop leaders who advance technology and improve the human condition. The Institute has nine key values that are foundational to everything we do:  

1\. Students are our top priority.  

2\. We strive for excellence.  

3\. We thrive on diversity.  

4\. We celebrate collaboration.  

5\. We champion innovation.  

6\. We safeguard freedom of inquiry and expression.  

7\. We nurture the wellbeing of our community.  

8\. We act ethically.  

9\. We are responsible stewards.  

  

Over the next decade, Georgia Tech will become an example of inclusive innovation, a leading technological research university of unmatched scale, relentlessly committed to serving the public good; breaking new ground in addressing the biggest local, national, and global challenges and opportunities of our time; making technology broadly accessible; and developing exceptional, principled leaders from all backgrounds ready to produce novel ideas and create solutions with real human impact.


**Job Summary**
---------------



We are searching for a motivated Temporary Accounting Assistant who is an excellent multitasker with exceptional communication and time management skills. The candidate can expect to assist the Accounting department with data entry, processing, and recording transactions, updating the ledger, assisting with audits or fact\-checking, and preparing budgets and reports. You should be thorough, accurate, and honest with good bookkeeping skills.


**Required Qualifications**
---------------------------



**Educational Requirements**  

Highschool diploma or equivalent  

  

**Other Required Qualifications**  

You should have an understanding of basic Accounting principles and proficiency with computers and software, such as MS Excel or Quickbooks. You should be trustworthy, efficient, and organized.  

  

**Required Experience**  

At least two years experience in an accounting role


**Preferred Qualifications**
----------------------------



**Preferred Educational Qualifications**  

Bachelors degree


**Knowledge, Skills, \& Abilities**
-----------------------------------



**SKILLS**  

Proficiency with computers and bookkeeping software, strong typing skills.  

Exceptional time management and verbal and written communication skills.  

Familiarity with basic accounting principles.  

Professional manner and a strong ethical code.  

Ability to multitask and remain motivated and positive.  

Commitment to working efficiently and accurately.


**USG Core Values**
-------------------



The University System of Georgia is comprised of our 26 institutions of higher education and learning as well as the System Office. Our USG Statement of Core Values are Integrity, Excellence, Accountability, and Respect. These values serve as the foundation for all that we do as an organization, and each USG community member is responsible for demonstrating and upholding these standards. More details on the USG Statement of Core Values and Code of Conduct are available in USG Board Policy 8\.2\.18\.1\.2 and can be found on\-line at https://www.usg.edu/policymanual/section8/C224/\#p8\.2\.18\_personnel\_conduct.


Additionally, USG supports Freedom of Expression as stated in Board Policy 6\.5 Freedom of Expression and Academic Freedom found on\-line at https://www.usg.edu/policymanual/section6/C2653\.


**Equal Employment Opportunity**
--------------------------------



The Georgia Institute of Technology (Georgia Tech) is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. The Institute is committed to maintaining a fair and respectful environment for all. To that end, and in accordance with federal and state law, Board of Regents policy, and Institute policy, Georgia Tech provides equal opportunity to all faculty, staff, students, and all other members of the Georgia Tech community, including applicants for admission and/or employment, contractors, volunteers, and participants in institutional programs, activities, or services. Georgia Tech complies with all applicable laws and regulations governing equal opportunity in the workplace and in educational activities.


Equal opportunity and decisions based on merit are fundamental values of the University System of Georgia (¿USG¿) and Georgia Tech. Georgia Tech prohibits discrimination, including discriminatory harassment, on the basis of an individual¿s race, ethnicity, ancestry, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy), national origin, age, disability, genetics, or veteran status in its programs, activities, employment, and admissions. Further, Georgia Tech prohibits citizenship status, immigration status, and national origin discrimination in hiring, firing, and recruitment, except where such restrictions are required in order to comply with law, regulation, executive order, or Attorney General directive, or where they are required by Federal, State, or local government contract.


**Other Information**
---------------------



This is not a supervisory position.  

This position does not have any financial responsibilities.  

This position will not be required to drive.  

This role is not considered a position of trust.  

This position does not require a purchasing card (P\-Card).  

This position will not travel  

This position does not require security clearance.


**Background Check**
--------------------


* Standard
